Package it.polimi.ingsw.Model.GameModel

Class ResourceManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.GameModel.ResourceManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ResourceManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
ResourceManager Class contains both a Warehouse and a Strongbox type objects (as final attributes). It is used to group all methods regarding resource management.

Attributes:

  • Warehouse "warehouse": the player's Warehouse
  • Strongbox "strongbox": the player's Strongbox
  • ResourceStack "temporaryResourcesToPay": contains the number of resources (divided by type) which the player has yet to either add to his Warehouse or pay
  • int "temporaryWhiteMarbles": number of white marbles which the player has to choose from, if he has more than two leader cards
See Also:
Serialized Form

      Returns:

    • countAllResourcesByType

      public int countAllResourcesByType​(ResourceType resourceType)
      Counts the total number of resources of a specified type stored in both the warehouse and the strongbox.
      Parameters:
      resourceType - Type of resource to count.
      Returns:
      the number of resources of the specified type

    • countResourcesToVictoryPoints

      public int countResourcesToVictoryPoints()
      Counts the number of victory points given to the player at the end of the game based of how many resources he has in his warehouse and strongbox.
      Returns:
      the corresponding victory points (total number of resources divided by 5).

    • addProductionResources

      public void addProductionResources​(ResourceStack resourceStack)
      Adds resources to the strongbox when a production process has been completed.
      Parameters:
      resourceStack - Stack containing the production's output, divided by type.

    • addMarketResourcesByType

      public int addMarketResourcesByType​(int resourcesToAdd, ResourceType type, WarehouseDepot depot)
      Adds a number of resources of a specified type coming from the market to a depot inside the Warehouse.

      The method checks if it is possible to fit the specified type of resources inside the depot, then either proceeds to compute the action, or notifies the player in case the resources cannot be stored inside the depot.

      Parameters:
      resourcesToAdd - Number of resources to add.
      type - Type of resources that have to be added
      depot - Depot where the player wants the resources to be added.
      Returns:
      the number of resources that could not fit inside the specified depot

    • canAddMarketResources

      public boolean canAddMarketResources()
      Checks if the player is able to fit any resource inside the Warehouse.
      Returns:
      true if at least one resources of any type fits.

    • canAddToDepot

      public boolean canAddToDepot​(ResourceType type, WarehouseDepot depot)
      Checks if one Type of resource can fit inside a specified Depot.
      Parameters:
      type - ResourceType of the resource to insert.
      depot - WarehouseDepot where the resource needs to be inserted.
      Returns:
      true if the resource can fit.

    • addOneResourceToDepot

      public void addOneResourceToDepot​(ResourceType type, WarehouseDepot depot)
      Adds one Resource of a specified Type inside a specified Depot. The Resource is also removed from the Temporary Resources to Pay.
      Parameters:
      type - Type of the resource to be inserted
      depot - Depot where the Resource will be inserted.

    • remainingResourcesToFaith

      public void remainingResourcesToFaith​(Player player, java.util.ArrayList<Player> players, FaithTrack faithTrack) throws ModelException
      Transforms remaining resources of a market interaction into faith points for all non currently playing players.
      Parameters:
      player - Player who's playing now.
      players - All player's of the current game.
      faithTrack - Faith Track of the current game.
      Throws:
      ModelException

    • hasPayed

      public boolean hasPayed()
      Checks if the player finished paying the correct amount when activating production o buying a card.
      Returns:
      True if the player has payed all.

    • resourceIsNeededToPay

      public boolean resourceIsNeededToPay​(ResourceType resourceType)
      Checks if a specified Resource is needed to pay for the current transaction.
      Parameters:
      resourceType - Type of resource selected by the player.
      Returns:
      True if the Resource Type is needed to pay.

    • payOneResourceWarehouse

      public void payOneResourceWarehouse​(WarehouseDepot depot)
      Pays one resource from a Warehouse Depot.
      Parameters:
      depot - Warehouse Depot to take the resource from.

    • payOneResourceStrongbox

      public void payOneResourceStrongbox​(ResourceType type)
      Pays one resource from the Strongbox.
      Parameters:
      type - Resource Type the player wants to pay.

    • cardIsBuyable

      public boolean cardIsBuyable​(DevelopmentCard developmentCard, LeaderCard[] leaderCards)
      Checks if a specified card is buyable from the player.

      The player is notified if he doesn't have enough resources to buy the card.

      Parameters:
      developmentCard - Card the player wants to buy.
      Returns:
      true if the card is buyable.

    • hasResourcesToActivateLeaderCard

      public boolean hasResourcesToActivateLeaderCard​(LeaderCard leaderCard)
      Checks if a specified leader card can be activated by the player.

      The player is notified if he doesn't have enough resources to activate the leader card.

      Parameters:
      leaderCard - Card the player wants to activate.
      Returns:
      true if the card can be activated.

    • activateLeaderDepot

      public void activateLeaderDepot​(LeaderCard leaderCard) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Activates an extra Leader Depot of the type specified by a Leader Card.
      • The LeaderCard's ability has to be of type "EXTRADEPOT" and ACTIVE, or else an Error message is displayed.
      • This method is to be called ONCE (when it's activated) for each LeaderCard the player possesses, only if the LeaderCard's ability is of type "EXTRADEPOT".
      Parameters:
      leaderCard - LeaderCard used to activate the depot
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
